section.section: There is a Board for the Chesapeake Employers' Insurance Company.
The Board shall manage the business and affairs of the Company as a private, nonprofit corporation in accordance with State law.

text.section: The Board shall consist of nine members appointed by the Governor with the advice and consent of the Senate.
Each member shall be a resident of the State.
Before taking office, each appointee to the Board shall take the oath required by Article I, § 9 of the Maryland Constitution.

section.section: The term of a member is 5 years.
The terms of members are staggered as required by the terms provided for members of the Board for the Fund on October 1, 1991.
At the end of a term, a member continues to serve until a successor is appointed and qualifies.
A member who is appointed after a term has begun serves only for the rest of the term and until a successor is appointed and qualifies.

A member may not serve for more than:
two full terms; or
a total of 10 years.

text.section: The Governor may remove a member for incompetence or misconduct.
The Board shall adopt rules, bylaws, and procedures.
